title: Use of Nick's Blandford Woodland
content:
Hi,  
I finished the costume book **[Tribal Vibes for Bellydancers](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017015748/http:/www.costumegoddess.com/books/tribal.htm)** I mentioned on this forum a few months ago. Thought you might like to see how I used Nick's font "Blandford Woodland" in a photo gallery spread. I bought this awhile back cause it's so beautiful, but never could find the right use for it before this.

Here it is titling the "Shaman" costuming of a troupe.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017015748im_/http:/typophile.com/files/screenshot-shaman_6402.jpg)

Here's what it looks like in the context of the spread called "Fantasy". The facing page featuring the Amazon costume is "Sultan" by Cananda type.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017015748im_/http:/typophile.com/files/screenshot-shaman-amazone_4702.jpg)
author: dinazina

comments.content: Amazing! This is exactly the kind of use I had in mind when I cobbled this font together!
I am so pleased to have approval from the (famous) designer!!

Here is my layout for the "Vintage Hollywood" page, where I used Nick's "Londonderry Air" to depict the silent film era.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017015748im_/http:/typophile.com/files/screenshot-vintage-hollywoo_5265.jpg)

The "photo-mounting corners" are from the Franklin Corners font. I'm old enough to remember those little adhesive corners that always fell off after a few decades.

Yes, I got permission from the person who posted a high quality scan of the silent film actress from his collection.
